lines.gurmukhi: nwieku hY eyku Aru nwiekw Ast qw kY eyk eyk nwiekw ky pwNc pwNc pUq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naaiku Hai Ayku Aru Naaikaa Asat Taa Kai , Ayk Ayk Naaikaa Kay Paanch Paanch Poot Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: There is only one master of the house. He has eight wives and each wife has five sons.

lines.gurmukhi: eyk eyk pUq giH cwir cwir nwqI eykY eykY nwqI doie pqnI pRsUq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ayk Ayk Poot Grih Chaari Chaari Naatee , Aykai Aykai Naatee Doi Patanee Prasoot Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Every son has four sons. Thus every grandson of the master has two child-bearing wives.

lines.gurmukhi: qwhU qy Anyk puin eykY eykY pwNc pwNc qw qy cwir cwir suiq sMqiq sMBUq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Taahoo Tay Anayk Pouni Aykai Aykai Paanch Paancha , Taa Tay Chaari Chaari Souti Santati Sanbhoot Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then several children were born of those wives. Each bore five sons and then four more sons.

lines.gurmukhi: qw qy AwT AwT suqw suqw suqw AwT suq AYso prvwru kYsy hoie eyk sUq hY ]228]
lines.transliteration_english: Taa Tay Aatth Aatth Soutaa Soutaa Soutaa Aatth Souta , Aiso Paravaaru Kaisay Hoi Ayk Soot Hai ?228?

Shabad OS B.translation: Each of these sons produced eight daughters and then eight sons came forth from each daughter. One who has such a big family, how can he be stringed in one thread. This is the spread of the mind. Its expanse has no end. How can a mind with such vast sprea
